alert.note: Alert for City of Hyder (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 11:52PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...RELEASE OF GLACIER DAMMED LAKE ON THE SALMON RIVER NEAR HYDER... WATER LEVELS ON THE SALMON RIVER NEAR HYDER, ALASKA BEGAN RISING BEYOND THE NORMAL DAILY RISE ON SUNDAY NIGHT. THE RIVER HAS BEEN RISING AT APPROXIMATELY 1 FOOT IN 18 HOURS. IN THE PAST THIS EVENT IS ABOUT 4 DAYS LONG FROM START TO FINISH, WHICH WOULD PUT THE CREST ON THURSDAY THE 29TH. HOWEVER, THIS IS AN EARLIER THAN NORMAL RELEASE FROM SUMMIT LAKE SO THERE MAYBE LESS VOLUME OF WATER WITH LESS TIME TO FILL FROM SNOW MELT. MARINERS IN THE AREA OF THE RIVER AND PORTLAND CANAL SHOULD WATCH FOR ADDITIONAL DEBRIS IN THE WATER AND BE AWARE OF COLDER WATER TEMPERATURES. WE WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE RIVER IN COORDINATION WITH THE ALASKA PACIFIC RIVER FORECAST CENTER AND THE US FOREST SERVICE IN HYDER.
